author: tersec
content: as in, that PR for 6110 increases complexity, or 6110 does? I have no strong view on the latter for this purpose, but ensuring it doesn't have to deal with forked validator indices definitely decreases complexity compared with 6110 as initially specified

author: tersec
content: Another perhaps hidden (? not that hidden, but not explicitly spelled out in the spec changes) reduction in complexity is that currently CLs need to track the EL chain in a way they simply would not anymore. Whole subsystem gone. So some changes in mechanism but towards what seems to me to be a clearly overall less complex and error-prone system.

author: tersec
content: Right now, the complexity of this is real, but not surfaced explicitly well in the CL specs, but rather represented implicitly as one of the many implementation-specific abstractions which doesn't get meaningfully executable Python code. 6110 replaces this with a larger explicit, but smaller implicit, surface.
